programme.title: T100 Triathlon - PTO - World Tour 2025 Final - Doha
programme.desc: The T100 Triathlon World Tour Final lands in Doha/Lusail (10–13 December 2025) as the season-ending showdown that crowns the T100 World Champion. Featuring the world-class professional field, the race is contested over the T100 format (2km swim, 80km bike, 18km run) on a course set around Doha and Lusail, with the decisive pro race scheduled for 12 December 2025 (09:45 AST) in Qatar.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Sevilla - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Espanyol have only won one of their last six LaLiga games against Elche, the last of which was a 1-0 win in February 2023, and have not won two consecutive games against them in the competition since March 1985. After five consecutive home wins against Elche in LaLiga between 1975 and 1984, Espanyol have won just one of their subsequent five league matches against them at home, failing to win any of the last three.

programme.title: Arsenal vs Aston Villa - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 19
programme.desc: Arsenal have lost three of their last five Premier League matches against Aston Villa and could see Villa complete a league double over them for the third time in six seasons, something they’d done so just once previously in the competition beforehand, in 1992-93. Aston Villa are unbeaten in their last two away league games against Arsenal, beating them 2-0 in April 2024 and drawing 2-2 in January last season. They last had a longer run without defeat the Emirates between 2006-07 and 2008-09.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Newcastle United- English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost four of their last five Premier League games against Newcastle, as many as they had in their previous 38 against the Magpies. Newcastle did the league double over Manchester United last season, including a 2-0 win in this exact fixture. They’ve not won consecutive visits to Old Trafford since March 1935, while they last won three in a row against the Red Devils in January 1922.

programme.desc: Liverpool have won 16 of their last 17 Premier League games against Wolves, with the exception being a 3-0 loss at Molineux in February 2023. programme.title: Real Madrid vs Sevilla - Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 17 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Espanyol have only won one of their last six LaLiga games against Elche, the last of which was a 1-0 win in February 2023, and have not won two consecutive games against them in the competition since March 1985. After five consecutive home wins against Elche in LaLiga between 1975 and 1984, Espanyol have won just one of their subsequent five league matches against them at home, failing to win any of the last three.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Newcastle United- English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost four of their last five Premier League games against Newcastle, as many as they had in their previous 38 against the Magpies. Newcastle did the league double over Manchester United last season, including a 2-0 win in this exact fixture. They’ve not won consecutive visits to Old Trafford since March 1935, while they last won three in a row against the Red Devils in January 1922.

programme.title: Arsenal vs Brighton & Hove Albion - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 18 - Mini Match

programme.title: Liverpool vs Wolverhampton Wanderers - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 18 - Mini Match

programme.title: Arsenal vs Aston Villa - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 19
programme.desc: Arsenal have lost three of their last five Premier League matches against Aston Villa and could see Villa complete a league double over them for the third time in six seasons, something they’d done so just once previously in the competition beforehand, in 1992-93. Aston Villa are unbeaten in their last two away league games against Arsenal, beating them 2-0 in April 2024 and drawing 2-2 in January last season. They last had a longer run without defeat the Emirates between 2006-07 and 2008-09.

They have not won two consecutive away LaLiga matches against Real Sociedad since 2011.

programme.title: Liverpool vs Wolverhampton Wanderers - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Liverpool have won 16 of their last 17 Premier League games against Wolves, with the exception being a 3-0 loss at Molineux in February 2023. Wolves have lost their last eight Premier League away games against Liverpool, since a 1-0 win in December 2010. In their top-flight history, only at Man City and the Reds themselves have they had longer losing runs on the road.

programme.desc: Espanyol have only won one of their last six LaLiga games against Elche, the last of which was a 1-0 win in February 2023, and have not won two consecutive games against them in the competition since March 1985. After five consecutive home wins against Elche in LaLiga between 1975 and 1984, Espanyol have won just one of their subsequent five league matches against them at home, failing to win any of the last three.

programme.title: Manchester United vs Newcastle United- English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 18 - Mini Match
programme.desc: Manchester United have lost four of their last five Premier League games against Newcastle, as many as they had in their previous 38 against the Magpies. Newcastle did the league double over Manchester United last season, including a 2-0 win in this exact fixture. They’ve not won consecutive visits to Old Trafford since March 1935, while they last won three in a row against the Red Devils in January 1922.

programme.title: Liverpool vs Wolverhampton Wanderers - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 18 - Mini Match

programme.title: Arsenal vs Aston Villa - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 19
programme.desc: Arsenal have lost three of their last five Premier League matches against Aston Villa and could see Villa complete a league double over them for the third time in six seasons, something they’d done so just once previously in the competition beforehand, in 1992-93. Aston Villa are unbeaten in their last two away league games against Arsenal, beating them 2-0 in April 2024 and drawing 2-2 in January last season. They last had a longer run without defeat the Emirates between 2006-07 and 2008-09.

Angers have won just 16% of their home games against Nantes in Ligue 1, only posting a lower ratio against Paris SG among teams they have hosted at least five times in the top-flight.

Chengdu Rongcheng FC vs Gangwon FC (KOR) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: Chengdu Rongcheng will face Gangwon for the first time in AFC Champions League Elite; each of the last three games in the competition between teams from Korea and China have been won by the former by an exact 2-1 score, including Gangwon’s win over Shanghai Shenhua in the first round of the 2025-26 season. Gangwon beat Shanghai Shenhua 2-1 in their first ever AFC Champions League Elite game at home; the last Korean side to suffer at least one defeat in their first two games in the competition is Jeju United in 2011, while no side from Korea has suffered defeat in their first away game in the AFC Champions League Elite.

programme.title: Vissel Kobe (JPN) vs Melbourne City FC (AUS) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - East MD2
programme.desc: This will be the first AFC Champions League Elite fixture between Vissel Kobe and Melbourne City; City are without a win in any of their three Champions League Elite games against Japanese sides, while Kobe have won their only previous game against an Australian opposition in the competition. Vissel Kobe won their last AFC Champions League Elite game against Shanghai Port by a 3-0 margin; however, they have not won consecutive games in the competition since their three-match winning run between October and November 2024.

programme.title: Al Ittihad Club (KSA) vs Shabab Al Ahli (UAE) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD2
programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Al-Ittihad and Shabab Al Ahli in AFC Champions League Elite history; teams from Saudi Arabia have won seven of their last eight games in the competition against teams from UAE, however, the one loss in this run was Al-Ittihad’s 1-2 loss to Al Wahda in their opening matchday of the 2025-26 season. Al-Ittihad have lost each of their last three AFC Champions League Elite games, their joint-longest run of such games in the competition, including a 1-2 loss to Al Wahda on Matchday 1; Al-Ittihad have never lost each of their first two games of an AFC Champions League Elite campaign and only twice have they failed to win any of their first two games.

programme.title: Burnley vs Newcastle United - English Premier League 2025/2026 Week 19
programme.desc: Burnley have scored exactly once in all seven of their Premier League home games against Newcastle, though they’ve lost each of the last three since a 1-0 victory in December 2019. Newcastle have won their last seven Premier League matches against Burnley – it is their joint longest winning run against an opponent in the top-flight, winning seven on the bounce against Bury between 1903 and 1906.

Arturo COELLO ESP Agustin TAPIA ARG vs Martin DI NENNO ARG Leandro ROMAN AUGSBURGUER ARG - Men’s Fin
programme.desc: Madrid sets the stage for a thrilling men’s final at the 2025 Premier Padel P1. Top seeds Arturo Coello and Agustín Tapia, the reigning powerhouse duo blending Spanish flair with Argentine precision, take on the all-Argentine pair Martín Di Nenno and Leandro Augsburger. A clash of styles is guaranteed: Coello’s dominance at the net and Tapia’s explosive creativity tested by Di Nenno’s defensive wizardry and Augsburger’s fearless power. The ultimate battle for the P1 crown.

programme.title: Lorenzo MUSETTI (ITA) vs Carlos ALCARAZ (ESP) - Final Rolex Monte Carlo Masters - ATP 1000 - Monaco
programme.desc: In the 2025 Monte Carlo Masters final, No. 2 seed Carlos Alcaraz meets Lorenzo Musetti in a high-stakes clay-court clash. Alcaraz, chasing his first Monte Carlo title, reached his seventh Masters 1000 final after defeating Davidovich Fokina. Musetti, now the third Italian to reach this final in the Open Era, earned his spot by edging past Alex de Minaur. Alcaraz leads their head-to-head 3–1, with Musetti’s lone win coming on clay in Hamburg (2022).

programme.title: Gemma Triay Pons (Esp) Delfina Brea Senesi (Arg) vs Marta Ortega Gallego (Esp) Tamara Icardo Alcoris
programme.desc: Roland-Garros, Philippe-Chatrier. New World No.1s Gemma Triay/Delfi Brea meet Marta Ortega/Tamara Icardo with the Paris crown and 2,000 FIP points at stake. Triay/Brea reached the final after outlasting Ustero/Araujo; Ortega/Icardo ousted Sánchez/Josemaría in a statement win. Expect Triay/Brea’s aggressive shifts and overhead control against Ortega/Icardo’s structured patterns and backhand-volley accuracy. Net duels and smart lobs will tell.

programme.title: Casper Ruud (NOR) vs Jack Draper (GBR) - Final - Mutua Madrid Open 2025 - ATP 1000
programme.desc: In a first-ever ATP Tour meeting, clay-court specialist Casper Ruud takes on rising British star Jack Draper in the 2025 Madrid final. Ruud, a two-time Grand Slam finalist, is seeking his first Masters 1000 title. Draper, who claimed his breakthrough Masters win in Indian Wells earlier this season, aims to secure a second major trophy in 2025. A compelling battle awaits on the Caja Mágica clay.

programme.title: Jannik Sinner (ITA) vs Carlos Alcaraz (ESP) - Cincinnati Open 2025 - ATP 1000
programme.desc: World No. 1 Jannik Sinner, holder of four Masters 1000 titles and 20 ATP singles trophies, comes into the Cincinnati final after winning two titles this season, including the Australian Open and Wimbledon. Across the net stands Carlos Alcaraz, with seven Masters crowns, 21 career titles, and five tournament victories already in 2025. Their rivalry remains one of the sport’s most exciting, with Alcaraz leading the head-to-head 8–5.

programme.title: Casper Ruud (NOR) vs Denis Shapovalov (CAN) - Final - ATP 500 Dallas Open 2025
programme.desc: Unseeded Denis Shapovalov faces second seed Casper Ruud. Shapovalov reached the final by defeating top-seeded Taylor Fritz and defending champion Tommy Paul, securing his second and third Top 10 wins of the week. Ruud advanced after a challenging semifinal against Jaume Munar, winning in a third-set tiebreak. This final marks Shapovalov's pursuit of his third ATP title and first above the ATP 250 level, while Ruud aims for his 13th career title.

programme.title: Nants vs Paris - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Day 3 - Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe 2025
programme.desc: The Qatar Prix de l’Arc de Triomphe 2025 is Europe’s flagship Group 1 flat race, staged at Paris Longchamp over 2,400m (about 1m 4f) for elite three-year-olds and up. Run on turf at the heart of Arc weekend, it’s a pure championship test of pace, position, and stamina, drawing the season’s best middle-distance talent with a total purse around €5 million.

Run on turf at the heart of Arc weekend, it’s a pure championship test of pace, position, and stamina, drawing the season’s best middle-distance talent with a total purse around €5 million.

programme.title: Al Shamal vs Al Sadd - Qatar Stars League 2025/26 - W11
programme.desc: The Qatari League is the official football league in Qatar. The league includes 12 teams. The most famous participating clubs are Al-Sadd, the champions of the last season; Al-Rayyan and Al-Arabi, the popular teams, Al-Duhail and Al-Gharafa, serious contenders for the title every season. The Qatari league includes star names such as Firmino, Verratti, and Qatari Akram Afif, the best player in Asia.

programme.title: Montpellier vs Sant - Raphael - LNH Division 1 - French Handball Starligue
programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. Established in 1952, this premier league event features 16 top teams battling for glory. With Montpellier’s 14 Handball titles and Paris Saint-Germain's 11 wins, the competition is fierce. Champions earn spots in the EHF Champions League, while cup winners qualify for the European League.

programme.title: Angola vs Egypt - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Angola and Egypt are meeting in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations for the third time. The two previous encounters produced Egypt wins, in the 1996 group stages and 2008 quarter-finals. Each of the last four encounters between Angola and Egypt has produced a goal from the penalty spot.

programme.title: Tanzania vs Tunisia - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Tanzania and Tunisia in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Tunisia are unbeaten in their two previous encounters with Tanzania, both in November 2020 during CAF Africa Cup of Nations qualifying – winning 1-0 at home before drawing 1-1 away.

programme.title: Benin vs Senegal - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Benin and Senegal are meeting for the second time at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Their previous encounter came in the quarter-finals of the 2019 edition – Senegal won 1-0. Benin have lost six of their last seven matches against Senegal in all competitions, losing 1-0 most recently in a friendly in March 2024 via a Sadio Mané penalty.

programme.title: Uganda vs Nigeria - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Uganda and Nigeria are meeting for the second time at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, 47 years after their initial encounter. It was in the semi-finals of the 1978 edition – Uganda won 2-1. Uganda are unbeaten in their last three matches against Nigeria, winning two and drawing one. Nigeria’s last victory came in a March 2007 AFCON qualifier, thanks to a Nwankwo Kanu goal.

programme.title: Uganda vs Nigeria - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Uganda and Nigeria are meeting for the second time at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, 47 years after their initial encounter. Nigeria’s last victory came in a March 2007 AFCON qualifier, thanks to a Nwankwo Kanu goal.

programme.title: Uganda vs Nigeria - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Uganda and Nigeria are meeting for the second time at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, 47 years after their initial encounter. It was in the semi-finals of the 1978 edition – Uganda won 2-1. Uganda are unbeaten in their last three matches against Nigeria, winning two and drawing one. Nigeria’s last victory came in a March 2007 AFCON qualifier, thanks to a Nwankwo Kanu goal.

programme.title: Mozambique Vs Cameroon - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: This will be the first meeting between Mozambique and Cameroon in the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Mozambique’s last victory against the Indomitable Lions was 42 years ago, in an April 1983 AFCON qualifier.

programme.title: Benin vs Senegal - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Benin and Senegal are meeting for the second time at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations. Their previous encounter came in the quarter-finals of the 2019 edition – Senegal won 1-0. programme.title: Uganda vs Nigeria - African Cup of Nations - Morocco 2025
programme.desc: Uganda and Nigeria are meeting for the second time at the CAF Africa Cup of Nations, 47 years after their initial encounter. It was in the semi-finals of the 1978 edition – Uganda won 2-1. Uganda are unbeaten in their last three matches against Nigeria, winning two and drawing one. Nigeria’s last victory came in a March 2007 AFCON qualifier, thanks to a Nwankwo Kanu goal.

programme.title: AFCON Morocco 2025 Show
programme.desc: The 2025 Africa Cup of Nations, commonly known as AFCON 2025, marks the 35th edition of this prestigious biennial tournament organized by the Confederation of African Football (CAF). This edition will be hosted by Morocco for the second time, following its previous hosting in 1988. Stay updated with comprehensive coverage of the AFCON Morcco 2025 on beIN Sports News.
